intro: Xylophylla linearis, commonly known as the slender wood fern, is a perennial plant native to temperate regions. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear fronds. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with creeping underground stems that produce new shoots. Its leaves are typically bipinnate, with a delicate, feathery appearance. Xylophylla linearis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
